result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence Vincent Hale

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrence Vincent Hale appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Terrence Vincent Hale.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing following 22CF3887. Case is adjourned to Br. 10.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence Vincent Hale appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Terrence Vincent Hale.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has a new case pending. Parties are requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 10-21-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference in preliminary hearing court along with defendant's pending felony.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terrence Vincent Hale not in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Terrence Vincent Hale.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for defense motion to modify bail.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIED defense request to modify bail. Case is adjourned to 10-11-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail, filed.

Defendant Terrence Vincent Hale appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Terrence Vincent Hale.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Parks. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Terrence V. Hale - #2022008835, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

11:53 AM Defendant Terrence Vincent Hale not in court, defendant in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for status. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that the matter be set for a State v. Lee hearing.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10
Defendant Terrence Vincent Hale not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State request a State V-Lee hearing or a Status of counsel for the next court date. Court Grants Status of counsel request. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with EWH (DOB (7/26/1967)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Terrence Vincent Hale in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Terrence Vincent Hale in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terrence Vincent Hale appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3 and 4.   DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 10.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
